body_html: Yes, the backward scan is because the register -> outputs pathway frees things from the register list as it goes. I'll clarify. I am going to put tests in another PR because I want to get this merged and get the alpha documents out first. The test commit will be about testing all the corner cases: no-op graphs, use inputs 0, 1, 2 times, maybe attempt to create every graph + backward of a single instruction to make sure the trace continues to work.

body: Yes, the backward scan is because the register -> outputs pathway frees things from the register list as it goes. I'll clarify. I am going to put tests in another PR because I want to get this merged and get the alpha documents out first. The test commit will be about testing all the corner cases: no-op graphs, use inputs 0, 1, 2 times, maybe attempt to create every graph + backward of a single instruction to make sure the trace continues to work.
